page.title: 02Brief history continued
page.content: community with shoemakers and cordwainers who could supply shoes; carpenters who could make household furniture; tailors who made clothes, blacksmiths who could make the iron work. There was probably little need to leave the village and the excursions to Brecon, Sennybridge or Llandovery were for some voyages into total excitement, especially to the Brecon Fairs. People had jobs as masons and as general labourers and there were the more major industries of wool at Cwmdwr and the mills at Trecastle, Llywel and Cwmwysg. But was there sufficient employment available? For there was poverty.
